intro: Ilex affinis var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf holly, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It features glossy, ovate leaves that are typically 4–8 inches long and have a smooth, waxy texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in the spring, followed by bright red berries in the fall. Its foliage remains dense throughout the growing season, providing year-round interest in the landscape. It is often used as an ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
